communications.subject: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: Officer Profile database
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

A complete copy of the all the data tables underlying the "Office Profile" web application found at https://nypdonline.org/link/1026

I ask that all of the database tables that power the site are exported and delivered as simple comma-delimited text files. Since the records are already published online, they should be releasable under the Freedom of Information Law.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Ben Welsh

title: Last 20 emails and texts sent by NYPD Commissioner Keechant Sewell

communications.subject: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: Last 20 emails and texts sent by NYPD Commissioner Keechant Sewell
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

- The last 20 emails sent by NYPD Commissioner Keechant Sewell in her official email account before leaving office
- The last 20 text messages sent by NYPD Commissioner Keechant Sewell from her official city phone before leaving office

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Ben Welsh

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: FBI file: Brigid Berlin
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

A copy of FBI files on Brigid Berlin, a New York artist and socialite whose death was widely reported in the media in July 2020. Here is one example: https://www.nytimes.com/2020/07/18/arts/brigid-berlin-dead.html

According to news reports, she was born Brigid Emmett Berlin in Manhattan on Sept. 6, 1939. I request that you use those details to augment your search.

I request that your agency conduct a full CRS search, as well as a cross reference search, to retrieve records related to this prominent American.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Ben Welsh
